<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Assured Knowledge](/Feats.aspx?ID=1640) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Bard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=19" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 113 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Loremaster](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=65) (Level 8)

**Prerequisites**
[enigma muse](/Muses.aspx?ID=1)

</column>

---

You can procure information with confidence. Whenever you [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) using any skill (including [Bardic Lore](/Feats.aspx?ID=179)), you can forgo rolling your check to instead receive a result of 10 + your proficiency bonus (don't apply any other bonuses, penalties, or modifiers). As long as you are an expert in a skill, you meet the prerequisites for the [Automatic Knowledge](/Feats.aspx?ID=757) skill feat in that skill, even if you don't have [Assurance](/Feats.aspx?ID=756) in that skill.

<title level="2">Assured Knowledge leads to...</title>
[Enigma's Knowledge](/Feats.aspx?ID=1652)
name: Assured Knowledge
